tool_description: Combines Type A and Type B uncertainties with correlation effects to calculate combined standard uncertainty according to GUM uncertainty propagation law.

correlation_coefficient.description: Correlation coefficient between Type A and Type B (-1 to 1)

error_messages: Negative uncertainty values: Type A and Type B uncertainties must be positive.
Invalid correlation coefficient: Must be between -1 and 1.
Sensitivity coefficient mismatch: Number of sensitivity coefficients must match additional uncertainties.
Zero combined uncertainty: Result indicates calculation error, check input values.
Excessive correlation: High correlation values may indicate dependency issues in uncertainty sources.
usage: Input Type A and Type B uncertainties, optionally include sensitivity coefficients and correlations. Tool applies GUM uncertainty propagation law to calculate combined uncertainty.

variance_contributions.description: Variance contribution from each uncertainty component

effective_degrees_freedom.description: Effective degrees of freedom using Welch-Satterthwaite equation
